title: Sheeffry Hills
text:
The Sheeffry Hills or Sheeffry Mountains () is a range of <a href="hill">hill</a>s in <a href="County%20Mayo">County Mayo</a>, <a href="Ireland">Ireland</a>. It is bounded to the west by Glencullin Lough and <a href="Doo%20Lough%20%28Mayo%29">Doo Lough</a>; to the south by Glenummera and Tawnyard Lough; to the east by Owenmore Glen and to the north by the Bunowen River.
The highest peak is <a href="Barrclashcame">Barrclashcame</a> (772 m). The range also includes—from west to east—the peaks of Barrclashcame Northwest a.k.a. Storikeennageer (580 m), Tievummera (762 m), Tievnabinnia (742 m), Tawnyard (436 m) and Tawnyrower (510 m).
There are a number of <a href="lough">lough</a>s within the Sheeffry Hills, the two biggest being Lugacolliwee and Lugaloughan. The others are—from west to east—Lough Awaniareen, Lough Allisheen, Lough Tariff, Lough Brawn, Lugalough
Settlements in the area include <a href="Drummin%2C%20County%20Mayo">Drummin</a> and Carrowkennedy (to the east), <a href="Cregganbaun">Cregganbaun</a> (west), and <a href="Delphi%2C%20County%20Mayo">Delphi</a> (south). Carrowkennedy was the site of <a href="Carrowkennedy%20ambush">an ambush</a> in June 1921, during the <a href="Irish%20War%20of%20Independence">Irish War of Independence</a>.
